meanings.definition: To clean or wipe with a mop.
meanings.sent1: She mopped the floor after the spill.
meanings.sent2: I mopped the kitchen every Saturday.
meanings.sent3: The cat mopped up the milk with its tail.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness mopped away my tears.
meanings.sent5: The sun mopped up the rain with its warm rays.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she mopped the entire house.
meanings.sent2: He mopped the hallway last night.
meanings.sent3: The ghost mopped the floor while everyone slept.
meanings.sent4: His laughter mopped away the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The wind mopped through the trees, rustling the leaves.
